body: Thanks @weburnit for doing that.
Could you also implement an integration test for this?
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/UNOMI-419
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/UNOMI-420
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/UNOMI-421
Added integration tests

To address the question of where to put the configuration, a new configuration file for the base plugin could be added, something like org.apache.unomi.plugins.base.cfg. See the other bundles for examples on how to set that up.
Hello, it looks good to me. Do you think you could add an integration test or modify an existing one to validate this change? Thanks a lot.
I'll implement an integration test and merge this to both branches as soon as finished.

I'm merging this PR, I will provide the integrations test in a separate PR as I cannot commit to this branch.
Thx for the contribution !
@liatiusim did you see the previous question?
Hi @liatiusim any updates on this PR?

### Small update on what we discussed about in the call:

- Do not touch the unomi IncrementInterestAction. This action have his own logic and cannot be generify with property incrementation, also the interest incrementation from JExperience is not using this action, it's actually using a script and the setPropertyAction.
- Create a new Action: IncrementPropertyAction: 
  - propertyName: to be able to increment or create a single prop (properties.pageViewCount)
  - rootPropertyName: to be able to increment all props under this one: (ex: profile.properties.interest)
  - incrementWithValues: to be able to increment properties with the values coming from the event. (ex: event.properties.interest)
  - storeInSession: to be able to target the profile or the session.

### Real exemple coming from JEXperience:
**the increment page count:** 
```
"actions": [
    {
      "parameterValues": {
        "setPropertyName": "properties.pageViewCount",
        "setPropertyValue": "script::r = profile.properties['pageViewCount']; if (r == null) { profile.properties['pageViewCount'] = []; profile.properties.pageViewCount = [event.scope : 1] } else { if (r[event.scope] != null) { r[event.scope] = r[event.scope] + 1 } else { r[event.scope] = 1 }} r",
        "storeInSession": false
      },
      "type": "setPropertyAction"
    }
  ]
```

We should be able to do it with this kind of conf:
**type: incrementPropertyAction**
**paramerterValues:**
- **propertyName: properties.pageViewCount**
- **storeInSession: false**

**The increment interest from jexperience:**
```
"actions": [
    {
      "parameterValues": {
        "setPropertyName": "properties.interests",
        "setPropertyValue": "script::r = profile.properties['interests']; foreach(interest : event.target.properties['interests'].entrySet()) { if (r == null) { r = [interest.key: interest.value] } else if (r[interest.key] != null) { r[interest.key] = r[interest.key] + interest.value } else { r[interest.key] = interest.value } } r",
        "storeInSession": false
      },
      "type": "setPropertyAction"
    }
  ]
```

We should be able to replace it, with:
**type:incrementPropertyAction**
**paramerterValues:**
- **rootPropertyName: properties.interest**
- **incrementWithEventValues: target.properties.interest**
- **storeInSession: false**

This way we will be able to replace the script usage we have in the rules in JExperience to use a generic increment action.
The Existing IncrementInterestAction is missleading, and confusing because there is also interest incrementation in jexperience. But the both are completely differents.

> Thanks Kevan for fixing this. Could you however attach this to an existing ticket or create a new one?

It's already created, and current PR ticket number is the one I created for this occasion.
Oops I spoke too fast it seems there is a problem with the integration tests, could you check it please ?
Handled by #277

@sergehuber 
IT tests failed for Java 11, but work for Java 8. Looks like delay is too short to process an event and to refresh index during tests running.

Hey Serge,
Added the Jira number and added a cfg file
Thanks for the review
@liatiusim could you please update this ticket and create the JIRA and possibly an integration test ? If nothing is done I'll have to close this PR without merging.

Hey Serge, sorry for the late response.
Iv'e added a Jira task and updated the title of this PR. I'll add the itest soon
Thanks @liatiusim  !

> Could be great to use latest integration test and add a check to the responses to see that we correctly have the expected message. Currently we only test the status code, but status code 400 could be triggered by something else than the validation, so checking the message would be great.

We will do it in a separate PR
@liatiusim I'll wait until you commit the integration test to review this in the final state. Thanks

Hello Kevan, 

Is there a ticket for this PR? Maybe attach it to one of the existing ones ?
Hi @liatiusim thanks for this PR and sorry for taking so much time to review it. Looks good to me I'll merge it.

Hello @khangtruongbinh thanks for your PR. I don't understand however how the auto clean relates to http_proxy parameters ? 

Also could you please create a JIRA in the Unomi JIRA and add it to the title of this PR as is requested in the PR template ?

Regards,
  Serge...
Hi @liatiusim thanks for the PR. Could you explain what the code in the SetEventOccurenceAction is used for ? Taken out of context it is not very clear.

Hello @giladw, thank you for your PR, it is interesting. 

Have you seen the changes in the 2.0 branch? They introduce the possibility for property types to have sub-property types. Would these changes still work with that? 

Also, having some integration and/or unit tests for this would be really useful.
Looks like these dependencies are updatable in another way, so this is no longer needed.
Ok it took me a while to properly review this but I like it. @giladw I'd like to merge this to release it with 1.5.5. Could you add an integration tests later for this? I think it is important.
Hi @liatiusim it seems that after merging previous PRs some conflicts have appeared on this PR. Could you fix them please?
Hello @liatiusim . After reviewing this once more I've decided to include it for the 1.5.5 release, you can add an integration test in a separate PR. Thank you.
Also I think it would be interesting to sort of regroup the IncrementPropertyAction with some of this.
Hi @giladw could you add the JIRA ticket to the PR title to make it easier to cross reference ? Thank you
@sergehuber  edited the title of the pr
Hello, thank you for the PR. I like the improvement but I think it should include integration tests. Could you add some please?

Thx for the PR !
Seem's good to me.
Can you please provide a scenario, or more detail on how to use that parameter in the JIRA ticket? Thank you

Thank you for the answers.
If we are sure that elasticsearch have the same behavior when evaluating this condition I would say we are good.
But I'm not sure, do you know if ElasticSearch queries are also handling this case this way ?
Ideally we should be ISO to what elasticsearch is doing.
Unfortunately I am lacking time recently working on the GUI. So can't work on this at this time. If you would like to continue with changes to this PR please take over :)

Thank you for the contribution and improvement on the code!
Can I ask you to add few lines in https://github.com/apache/unomi/blob/master/docker/README.md to reflect those changes in case anyone want to use such credentials?

Ok no problem,
Are you ok if we close this pull request ?
In the future we will probably implement this features like we describe, but it's currently not our priority.
Sure.
Closing as approved.
@giladw would love your answer on this or we'll have to close the PR.
@Irenez753 did you see my last comment ? If this is no longer interesting I can just close the PR ?
@amitco1 Could you please provide integration tests for this ?
It has been merge as it uses already existing properties.
Overal I approve this because of the explaination I provided on the ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/UNOMI-482
@amitco1 would love your answer on this or we'll have to close the PR.

I'm working on implementing this in a proper way, it will be part of version 2.0.0-SNAPSHOT and 1.6.0-SNAPSHOT.
Basically I deprecated the "now" option (it will be still supported, but deprecated)
And I added this two action parameter:

- setPropertyValueCurrentDate
- setPropertyValueCurrentEventTimestamp

using the value of the parameter: setPropertyValue was not a good idea for people that would like to set the value: "now" or "eventArrivalTime". That is why I prefer to implement dedicated parameters to handle this cases.

This have been implemented in: https://github.com/apache/unomi/pull/329
and lastVisit calcul have been reworked.

Hello @giladw , could you consider the proposition to handle "hasNoneOf" ? so we can merge this PR and move one.

Thanks you,
Best regards.
Hey @sergehuber, is there a plan to merge this in any future release?

Hi @felipeelia this is currently merged into the master so it is currently scheduled for Unomi 2. As for backports into 1.x I'm not sure. 

Actually I was looking at creating a more generic action that could increment any property.

Hi @giladw,

As per our discussion on Slack, we're going to merge your PR as-is and do the requested modification in a follow-up PR.

Thanks,

cc: @sergehuber
As there was no activity on this PR and also I believe it would be more interesting to be able to load different items with a MultipleGetRequest, we are closing this PR.
Closing because of no activity.

Failing integration test is passing locally.
Also I would appreciate a more descriptive title for the PR :)

Drop this PR to change the global approach to fix the issue. Disabling the rule was not working as it might be an issue to identify rules that have been disabled because of invalidity and rules willingly disabled. This mostly when we need to reenable them once conditions are met.

Best regards,

Looks like this PR is already up-to-date with master! If you'd still like to recreate it from scratch, overwriting any edits, you can request `@dependabot recreate`.

Hello Adrien, 

Thanks for the PR, but after some thinking this might be problematic in terms of security. In Unomi 2 we have a new system to protect the data that allows these types to be used. 

Let's continue this discussion in the mailing list.

Regards,
  Serge...

Hello Jonathan, thanks for the PR. 

Could you provide at least a ticket number in this PR?

Regards,
  Serge...
This POC is no longer valid since we have completely refactored the schema service.
@pmi Did you have a chance to look at @jkevan 's comments above ?
@Fgerthoffert Sorry I haven't yet, but have that in my to-do list and going to do so as soon as I have time.
After further consideration this is too risky from a security standpoint so I prefer we don't include it.

Hello, 

Thank you for your interesting contribution. Please note that we require integration tests for such contributions. Also, I've put a comment on the ticket (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/UNOMI-601) because I was thinking about these type of metadata more globally. Could you please check and look there to see how we want to move forward with this?

Best regards,
  Serge Huber.

Hello,

Thank you for your contribution. We require that pull requests are associated with a ticket in Unomi's JIRA. Could you please either create a ticket there or associate it to an existing one (if you can find a relevant one). You can find the Unomi JIRA here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/UNOMI/summary

Best regards,
  Serge Huber.
Also, once you have created a ticket, please update the title of the PR to include the ticket number in the title. Thank you.

Regards,
Kevan
